title: python/its-status: collect all cellular KPIs
body:
**New feature:**

* `its-status`: collect and report signal KPIs for all radios

Closes: #74

---
**How to test:**

Prerequisites: a machine with a cellular modem, preferably one that is capable
of using more than one radio per connection.

1. build and install `python/its-status` with standard setuptools procedure, e.g.:
    ```sh
    $ pip3 wheel .
    $ pip3 install its_status-0.0.0-py3-none-any.whl
    ```
   Also take note of where the script has been installed (e.g. `${HOME}/.local/bin`)
2. create a configuration file, using `its-status.cfg` as startup point, adapt with your
   MQTT broker and credentials (or disable MQTT altogether), and enable the `stdout` emitter;
3. run `its-status` using your custom configuration file:
    ```sh
    $ ${HOME}/.local/bin/its-status -c /path/to/its-status.custom.cfg
    ```

---
**Expected results:**

1. The `its-status` package is installed;
2. You have a custom configuration file;
3. The `its-status` program runs, and the messages are visible `its-status`' `stdout`; the
   _celullar_ section contains KPIs for all the radios used for each cellular connection.

title: python/its-client: fix acceleration
body:
Bug fix:

* #75 
* #76 

Fixes: #76 #75

---
**How to test:**

1. Build and install `python/its-client` with standard setuptools procedure, e.g. (replace XXXXX by appropriate values):
    ```sh
    $ cd python/its-client
    $ pip3 wheel .
    $ pip3 install its_client-XXXXX.whl
    ```
   Also take note of where the script has been installed (e.g. `${HOME}/.local/bin`)
2. Run its-client in a setup where there is an actual GNSS device driven by gpsd
3. Move around a large area (preferably with a car in an area of at least 200m × 200m)

---
**Expected results:**

1. The `its-client` package is installed;
2. The `its-client` program runs, receives data from gpsd, and emits CAM messages
3. The CAM messages contain correct acceleration values; the `its-client` program
   terminates immediately when there is an MQTT issue (and if managed by a service
   manager, it gets restarted).

title: Cpm missing structs
body:
What's new
----------------

* Add missing `free_space_addendum_container` in `CollectivePerceptionMessage`
* Add missing `stationary_sensor_*` fields in `DetectionArea`
* Add corresponding structs definitions for
  * StationarySensorRadial
  * CircularArea
  * EllipticArea
  * RectangleArea
  * Offset
* Add `is_pedestrian_lane` in `MAPExtendedMessage`

title: python/its-status: add config option for the data directory
body:
**New feature:**

* `its-status`:
  * add config option for the data directory (#63)
  * be resilient against older lshw versions

---
**How to test:**

1. build and install `python/its-status` with standard setuptools procedure, e.g.:
    ```sh
    $ pip3 wheel .
    $ pip3 install its_status-0.0.0-py3-none-any.whl
    ```
   Also take note of where the script has been installed (e.g. `${HOME}/.local/bin`)
2. create a configuration file, using `its-status.cfg` as startup point, adapt with your
   MQTT broker and credentials, change the data directory to a writable location, and
   enable the `stdout` emitter;
3. subscribe an MQTT client to your broker, on the status topic, e.g. with mosquitto_sub
   CLI client:
    ```sh
    $ mosquitto_sub -h BROKER -p PORT -u USERNAME -P PASSWORD -i ID -t 'status/#'
    ```
5. run `its-status` using your custom configuration file:
    ```sh
    $ ${HOME}/.local/bin/its-status -c /path/to/its-status.custom.cfg
    ```

---
**Expected results:**

1. The `its-status` package is installed;
2. You have a custom configuration file with your MQTT settings;
3. The MQTT client is connected to your MQTT broker;
4. The `its-status` program runs, and the messages are visible both on the `its-status`'
   own `stdout`, as well as on the MQTT client; the total and free space for the data
   directory is reported.

title: python/its-status: fix API of {cellular,system} collectors
body:
**Bug fix:**

* `its-status`: fix API of {cellular,system} collectors

Fixes: 295544cefde1841b7947e7f8aa53cdcb6847df5f and #54

---
**How to test:**

1. build and install `python/its-status` with standard setuptools procedure, e.g.:
    ```sh
    $ pip3 wheel .
    $ pip3 install its_status-0.0.0-py3-none-any.whl
    ```
   Also take not of where the script has been installed (e.g. `${HOME}/.local/bin`)
2. create a configuration file, using `its-status.cfg` as startup point, adapt with your
   MQTT broker and credentials, enable the `stdout` emitter;
3. subscribe an MQTT client to your broker, on the status topic, e.g. with mosquitto CLI clients:
    ```sh
    $ mosquitto_sub -h BROKER -p PORT -u USERNAME -P PASSWORD -i ID -t 'status/#'
    ```
4. run `its-status` using your custom configuration file:
    ```sh
    $ ${HOME}/.local/bin/its-status -c /path/to/its-status.custom.cfg
    ```

---
**Expected results:**

1. The `its-status` package is installed;
2. You have a custom configuration file with your MQTT settings;
3. The MQTT client is connected to your MQTT broker;
4. The `its-status` program runs, and the messages are visible both on the
   `its-status`' own `stdout`, as well as on the MQTT client.

title: Rust fixes
body:
What's new
---------------

* Bump `rumqttc` to version 0.19
* Set the maximum packet size to 256KB
  By default rumqttc sets this limit to 10KB which appeared to be insufficient
* Fix MQTT topic subscription in `pipeline.rs`
  Declaring a topic in the top topic list is now enough for the subscription to be made and routed

How to test
---------------

1. Launch a local broker
    ```
    systemctl start mosquitto
    ```
2. Start the its-client example on local broker
    ```
    cargo run --bin its-client -- --mqtt-client-id unique_client_id
    ```
3. Send each type of message 
    1. CPM
        ```
        mosquitto_pub -t "root/outQueue/v2x/cam/uuid/0/1/2/3" -m '{"type":"cpm","origin":"mec_application","version":"1.1.1","source_uuid":"ora_fake_01","timestamp":1674656236762,"message":{"protocol_version":0,"station_id":1213456,"generation_delta_time":0,"management_container":{"station_type":15,"reference_position":{"latitude":478417860,"longitude":24678940,"altitude":900},"confidence":{"position_confidence_ellipse":{"semi_major_confidence":1,"semi_minor_confidence":1,"semi_major_orientation":0},"altitude":0}},"sensor_information_container":[{"sensor_id":1,"type":3,"detection_area":{}}],"perceived_object_container":[{"object_id":25,"time_of_measurement":2,"confidence":{"x_distance":4095,"y_distance":4095,"x_speed":0,"y_speed":0,"object":10},"x_distance":487,"y_distance":-997,"x_speed":42,"y_speed":83,"object_age":1500,"dynamic_status":0,"classification":[{"object_class":{"single_vru":{"pedestrian":1}},"confidence":100}]}]}}'
        ```
    2. CAM
        ```
        mosquitto_pub -t "root/outQueue/v2x/cam/uuid/0/1/2/3" -m '{"type": "cam","origin": "self","version": "1.1.1","source_uuid": "ora_car_a1b2c3","timestamp": 1674657420302,"message": {"protocol_version": 1,"station_id": 123456,"generation_delta_time": 44950,"basic_container": {"station_type": 5,"reference_position": {"latitude": 412234567,"longitude": 11234561,"altitude": 15219},"confidence": {"position_confidence_ellipse": {"semi_major_confidence": 10,"semi_minor_confidence": 50,"semi_major_orientation": 1},"altitude": 1}},"high_frequency_container": {"heading": 2935,"speed": 7,"longitudinal_acceleration": 0,"drive_direction": 0,"vehicle_length": 40,"vehicle_width": 20,"confidence": {"heading": 2,"speed": 3,"vehicle_length": 0}},"low_freq_container": {"vehicle_role": 2}}}'
        ```
    3. DENM
        ```
        mosquitto_pub -t "root/outQueue/v2x/denm/uuid/0/1/2/3" -m '{"type":"denm","origin":"mec_application","version":"1.1.1","source_uuid":"ora_denm_01","timestamp":1674658807112,"message":{"protocol_version":2,"station_id":123456,"management_container":{"action_id":{"originating_station_id":13101,"sequence_number":3681},"detection_time":601743612112,"reference_time":601743612112,"event_position":{"latitude":412345678,"longitude":61234567,"altitude":4600},"validity_duration":10,"station_type":5},"situation_container":{"event_type":{"cause":94,"subcause":0}},"location_container":{"event_speed":0,"event_position_heading":2836,"traces":[]}}}'
        `
    4. MAP
        ```
        mosquitto_pub -t "root/outQueue/v2x/map/uuid/0/1/2/3" -m '{"origin":"mec_application","source_uuid":"ora_map_01","type":"map","message":{"sendingStationId":12,"lanes":[{"isVehicleLane":true,"nextChange":0,"toc":0,"right":false,"speedLimit":50,"geom":[[2.1234561,40.1234561],[2.1234562,40.1234562],[2.1234563,40.1234563],[2.1234564,40.1234564],[2.1234565,40.1234565],[2.1234566,40.1234566],[2.1234567,40.1234567]],"egress":false,"ingress":true,"left":false,"signalId":1,"id":1,"state":0,"approachId":0,"connections":[{"laneId":3,"action":1,"intersectionId":1293}]}],"protocolVersion":1,"id":1293,"region":8},"version":"1.0.0","timestamp":1674656504339,"management_container":{"reference_position":{"latitude":488395825,"longitude":23710727},"validity_duration":86400}}'
        ```
    5. SPAT
        ```
        mosquitto_pub -t "root/outQueue/v2x/spat/uuid/0/1/2/3" -m '{"origin":"mec_application","source_uuid":"ora_spat_01","type":"spat","message":{"sendingStationId":123456,"protocolVersion":2,"id":12,"region":51,"timestamp":1674656899009,"revision":1,"states":[{"toc":0,"nextChange":0,"id":1,"state":3,"nextChanges":[{"toc":0,"nextChange":0,"state":3}]},{"toc":0,"nextChange":0,"id":2,"state":6,"nextChanges":[{"toc":0,"nextChange":0,"state":6}]},{"toc":0,"nextChange":0,"id":3,"state":3,"nextChanges":[{"toc":0,"nextChange":0,"state":3}]},{"toc":0,"nextChange":0,"id":4,"state":6,"nextChanges":[{"toc":0,"nextChange":0,"state":6}]},{"toc":0,"nextChange":0,"id":5,"state":8,"nextChanges":[{"toc":0,"nextChange":0,"state":8}]},{"toc":0,"nextChange":0,"id":6,"state":8,"nextChanges":[{"toc":0,"nextChange":0,"state":8}]},{"toc":0,"nextChange":0,"id":7,"state":3,"nextChanges":[{"toc":0,"nextChange":0,"state":3}]},{"toc":0,"nextChange":0,"id":8,"state":6,"nextChanges":[{"toc":0,"nextChange":0,"state":6}]},{"toc":0,"nextChange":0,"id":9,"state":3,"nextChanges":[{"toc":0,"nextChange":0,"state":3}]},{"toc":0,"nextChange":0,"id":10,"state":3,"nextChanges":[{"toc":0,"nextChange":0,"state":3}]},{"toc":0,"nextChange":0,"id":11,"state":6,"nextChanges":[{"toc":0,"nextChange":0,"state":6}]},{"toc":0,"nextChange":0,"id":12,"state":3,"nextChanges":[{"toc":0,"nextChange":0,"state":3}]},{"toc":0,"nextChange":0,"id":13,"state":6,"nextChanges":[{"toc":0,"nextChange":0,"state":6}]},{"toc":0,"nextChange":0,"id":14,"state":3,"nextChanges":[{"toc":0,"nextChange":0,"state":3}]},{"toc":0,"nextChange":0,"id":15,"state":3,"nextChanges":[{"toc":0,"nextChange":0,"state":3}]},{"toc":0,"nextChange":0,"id":16,"state":6,"nextChanges":[{"toc":0,"nextChange":0,"state":6}]},{"toc":0,"nextChange":0,"id":17,"state":8,"nextChanges":[{"toc":0,"nextChange":0,"state":8}]},{"toc":0,"nextChange":0,"id":18,"state":8,"nextChanges":[{"toc":0,"nextChange":0,"state":8}]},{"toc":0,"nextChange":0,"id":19,"state":8,"nextChanges":[{"toc":0,"nextChange":0,"state":8}]},{"toc":0,"nextChange":0,"id":20,"state":8,"nextChanges":[{"toc":0,"nextChange":0,"state":8}]},{"toc":0,"nextChange":0,"id":21,"state":8,"nextChanges":[{"toc":0,"nextChange":0,"state":8}]},{"toc":0,"nextChange":0,"id":22,"state":8,"nextChanges":[{"toc":0,"nextChange":0,"state":8}]},{"toc":0,"nextChange":0,"id":23,"state":8,"nextChanges":[{"toc":0,"nextChange":0,"state":8}]},{"toc":0,"nextChange":0,"id":24,"state":8,"nextChanges":[{"toc":0,"nextChange":0,"state":8}]},{"toc":0,"nextChange":0,"id":25,"state":8,"nextChanges":[{"toc":0,"nextChange":0,"state":8}]},{"toc":0,"nextChange":0,"id":26,"state":8,"nextChanges":[{"toc":0,"nextChange":0,"state":8}]},{"toc":0,"nextChange":0,"id":27,"state":8,"nextChanges":[{"toc":0,"nextChange":0,"state":8}]},{"toc":0,"nextChange":0,"id":28,"state":8,"nextChanges":[{"toc":0,"nextChange":0,"state":8}]},{"toc":0,"nextChange":0,"id":29,"state":8,"nextChanges":[{"toc":0,"nextChange":0,"state":8}]},{"toc":0,"nextChange":0,"id":30,"state":8,"nextChanges":[{"toc":0,"nextChange":0,"state":8}]},{"toc":0,"nextChange":0,"id":31,"state":8,"nextChanges":[{"toc":0,"nextChange":0,"state":8}]},{"toc":0,"nextChange":0,"id":32,"state":8,"nextChanges":[{"toc":0,"nextChange":0,"state":8}]},{"toc":0,"nextChange":0,"id":33,"state":8,"nextChanges":[{"toc":0,"nextChange":0,"state":8}]},{"toc":0,"nextChange":0,"id":34,"state":8,"nextChanges":[{"toc":0,"nextChange":0,"state":8}]},{"toc":0,"nextChange":0,"id":35,"state":8,"nextChanges":[{"toc":0,"nextChange":0,"state":8}]},{"toc":0,"nextChange":0,"id":36,"state":8,"nextChanges":[{"toc":0,"nextChange":0,"state":8}]}]},"version":"1.0.0","timestamp":1674656899063,"management_container":{"reference_position":{"latitude":412345678,"longitude":21234567},"validity_duration":86400}}'
        ```
    6. INFO
        ```
        mosquitto_pub -t "root/outQueue/info/broker" -m '{"type":"broker","instance_id":"ora_broker_01","running":true,"timestamp":1674658970000,"validity_duration":610,"version":"1.1.0","public_ip_address":["127.0.0.1"],"mqtt_ip":["127.0.0.1:11883"],"mqtt_tls_ip":["127.0.0.1:18883"],"ntp_servers":["0.debian.pool.ntp.org","1.debian.pool.ntp.org"],"domain_name_servers":["1.1.1.1"],"gelf_loggers":["127.0.0.1:121"],"udp_loggers":["127.0.0.1:122"],"tcp_loggers":["127.0.0.1:124"],"fbeat_loggers":["127.0.0.1:123"],"server_type":"cloud","instance_type":"central","service_area":{"type":"point","coordinates":[40.123456,1.123456],"radius":544000}}'
        ```
    **=> For each ITS message type you must see a reception log in stdout**
    > unique_client_id_10001 cam received_on ora_broker_01/root/outQueue/v2x/cam/ora_car_a1b2c3 123456/28776 at 1674660080998  
    > unique_client_id_10001 cpm received_on ora_broker_01/root/outQueue/v2x/cpm/ora_fake_01 1213456/0 at 1674660132025  
    > unique_client_id_10001 spat received_on ora_broker_01/root/outQueue/v2x/cpm/ora_spat_01 123456/12/51 at 1674660147774  
    > unique_client_id_10001 map received_on ora_broker_01/root/outQueue/v2x/cpm/ora_map_01 12/1293/8 at 1674660151096  
    > unique_client_id_10001 denm received_on ora_broker_01/root/outQueue/v2x/cpm/ora_denm_01 123456/13101/3681/601743612112/601743612112 at 1674660156782  

    **=> For the info message you have to check the log for the reception notification**
    > [2023-01-25 16:10:20.425982 +01:00] T["reader-configurator"] INFO [libits-client/src/pipeline.rs:356] we received an information on the topic root/outQueue/v2x/info/broker: Information {...}
7. Send a message payload bigger thant 10KB
    ```
    mosquitto_pub -t "root/outQueue/v2x/cpm/uuid/0/1/2/3" -m '{"type":"cpm","origin":"mec_application","version":"1.1.1","source_uuid":"ora_bigcpm_01","timestamp":1674656236762,"message":{"protocol_version":0,"station_id":1213456,"generation_delta_time":0,"management_container":{"station_type":15,"reference_position":{"latitude":478417860,"longitude":24678940,"altitude":900},"confidence":{"position_confidence_ellipse":{"semi_major_confidence":1,"semi_minor_confidence":1,"semi_major_orientation":0},"altitude":0}},"sensor_information_container":[{"sensor_id":1,"type":3,"detection_area":{}}],"perceived_object_container":[{"object_id":25,"time_of_measurement":2,"confidence":{"x_distance":4095,"y_distance":4095,"x_speed":0,"y_speed":0,"object":10},"x_distance":487,"y_distance":-997,"x_speed":42,"y_speed":83,"object_age":1500,"dynamic_status":0,"classification":[{"object_class":{"single_vru":{"pedestrian":1}},"confidence":100}]},{"object_id":25,"time_of_measurement":2,"confidence":{"x_distance":4095,"y_distance":4095,"x_speed":0,"y_speed":0,"object":10},"x_distance":487,"y_distance":-997,"x_speed":42,"y_speed":83,"object_age":1500,"dynamic_status":0,"classification":[{"object_class":{"single_vru":{"pedestrian":1}},"confidence":100}]},{"object_id":25,"time_of_measurement":2,"confidence":{"x_distance":4095,"y_distance":4095,"x_speed":0,"y_speed":0,"object":10},"x_distance":487,"y_distance":-997,"x_speed":42,"y_speed":83,"object_age":1500,"dynamic_status":0,"classification":[{"object_class":{"single_vru":{"pedestrian":1}},"confidence":100}]},{"object_id":25,"time_of_measurement":2,"confidence":{"x_distance":4095,"y_distance":4095,"x_speed":0,"y_speed":0,"object":10},"x_distance":487,"y_distance":-997,"x_speed":42,"y_speed":83,"object_age":1500,"dynamic_status":0,"classification":[{"object_class":{"single_vru":{"pedestrian":1}},"confidence":100}]},{"object_id":25,"time_of_measurement":2,"confidence":{"x_distance":4095,"y_distance":4095,"x_speed":0,"y_speed":0,"object":10},"x_distance":487,"y_distance":-997,"x_speed":42,"y_speed":83,"ob title: build(deps): bump tokio from 1.23.0 to 1.23.1 in /rust

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

body:
Bumps [tokio](https://github.com/tokio-rs/tokio) from 1.23.0 to 1.23.1.
Release notes

Sourced from tokio's releases.

Tokio v1.23.1

This release forward ports changes from 1.18.4.

Fixed

  • net: fix Windows named pipe server builder to maintain option when toggling pipe mode (#5336).

#5336: tokio-rs/tokio#5336

Commits
  • 1a997ff chore: prepare Tokio v1.23.1 release
  • a8fe333 Merge branch 'tokio-1.20.x' into tokio-1.23.x
  • ba81945 chore: prepare Tokio 1.20.3 release
  • 763bdc9 ci: run WASI tasks using latest Rust
  • 9f98535 Merge remote-tracking branch 'origin/tokio-1.18.x' into fix-named-pipes-1.20
  • 9241c3e chore: prepare Tokio v1.18.4 release
  • 699573d net: fix named pipes server configuration builder
  • See full diff in compare view

[![Dependabot compatibility score](https://dependabot-badges.githubapp.com/badges/compatibility_score?dependency-name=tokio&package-manager=cargo&previous-version=1.23.0&new-version=1.23.1)](https://docs.github.com/en/github/managing-security-vulnerabilities/about-dependabot-security-updates#about-compatibility-scores) Dependabot will resolve any conflicts with this PR as long as you don't alter it yourself. You can also trigger a rebase manually by commenting `@dependabot rebase`. [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-start) [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-end) ---
Dependabot commands and options
You can trigger Dependabot actions by commenting on this PR: - `@dependabot rebase` will rebase this PR - `@dependabot recreate` will recreate this PR, overwriting any edits that have been made to it - `@dependabot merge` will merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot squash and merge` will squash and merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot cancel merge` will cancel a previously requested merge and block automerging - `@dependabot reopen` will reopen this PR if it is closed - `@dependabot close` will close this PR and stop Dependabot recreating it. You can achieve the same result by closing it manually - `@dependabot ignore this major version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this major version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this minor version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this minor version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this dependency` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this dependency (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot use these labels` will set the current labels as the default for future PRs for this repo and language - `@dependabot use these reviewers` will set the current reviewers as the default for future PRs for this repo and language - `@dependabot use these assignees` will set the current assignees as the default for future PRs for this repo and language - `@dependabot use this milestone` will set the current milestone as the default for future PRs for this repo and language You can disable automated security fix PRs for this repo from the [Security Alerts page](https://github.com/Orange-OpenSource/its-client/network/alerts).

title: python/its-client: send own messages to the outQueue of the local broker
body:
**Bug fix:**

* #57

---
**How to test:**

Pre-requisites: an MQTT broker running

1. Check the messages on your MQTT broker, displaying topic (`%t`) and payload (`%p`):
    ```sh
    $ mosquitto_sub -t '#' -F '%t %p'
    ```
2. Configure its-client to connect to your MQTT broker as a mirror broker, without mirroring self; run its-client
3. Configure its-client to connect to your MQTT broker as a mirror broker, with mirroring self; run its-client

---
**Expected results:**

1. The messages are displayed as they are emitted
2. The messages are all on the outQueue
3. The messages are all on the outQueue, and the CAM is duplicated from the one on the inQueue.

title: python/its-info: new client to send info messages
body:
**Features:**

* _its-info_: a new client to send ETSI information messages

---
**How to test:**

Preparatory steps: have a MQTT broker running.

1. Build and install the package in `python/its-info/` with the standard
   setup-tools procedure:
    ```sh
    $ cd python/its-info/
    $ pip3 wheel .
    $ pip3 install its_info-0.0.0-py3-none-any.whl
    ```
   Note where the `its-info` is installed, e.g. `${HOME}/.local/bin`
2. Update the configuration `its-info.cfg` to match your local setup,
   especially the MQTT broker settings; choose a short period, like a
   few seconds.
3. Run a MQTT client that listens on the `info` topic (or whatever you
   configured in `its-info.cfg`):
    ```sh
    $ mosquitto_sub -h BROKER -p PORT -u USERNAME -P PASSWORD -i ID -t info
    ```
4. Run the client, and wait for a few periods (as configured in `its-info.cfg`):
    ```sh
    $ ${HOME}/.local/bin/its-info --config its-info.cfg
    ```
5. Terminate `its-info` (with Ctrl-C)
6. Stop and restart the MQTT client

---
**Expected results:**

1. The wheel is built and installed.
2. The configuration file is set for your local setup.
3. The MQTT client listens for messages.
4. The `its-info` client runs (it's silent), the MQTT client display info messages
   to the cofigured period.
6. The info message is no longer updated.
7. The MQTT client displays the last info message that was retained in the broker.

title: python/its-status: re-architect main loop and data capturing
body:
**Features:**

* switch from a [signal(7)](https://linux.die.net/man/7/signal) to a [timerfd(2)](https://linux.die.net/man/2/timerfd_create) to drive the main loop
* run plugins in their own individual threads

---
**How to test:**

See #43 

---
**Expected results:**

See #43

title: 1.4.0: MobilePerceivedObject RSU computation + SPATEM/MAPEM
body:
What's new ?
------------------

* Message no longer implements Mobile trait
* `as_mobile()` method added to Message to access Mobile when manipulating generic Message
* SPATEM struct
* MAPEM struct
* Extend PerceivedObject management to RSU originating CPM
* Bump version to 1.4.0

How to test
---------------
1. Build and test the lib and examples
    ```
    cargo clean; cargo build --all; cargo test --all
    ```
    **=> Build must success**  
    **=> All tests must pass**  

2. Start local mosquitto server
    ```
    systemctl start mosquitto
    ```

3. Start its-client
    ```
    cargo run --bin its-client -- --mqtt-client-id unique_id_111 --root-topic 5GCroCo/inQueue
    ```

4. Start the Paul Sabatier's single vehicle SUMO scenario
    ```
    ./start.sh -H localhost -P 1883 --mqtt-client-id sumo_ps_nbu -c ../sumo-paul-sabatier/sumo_data/static_vehicle.sumocfg
    ```
    **=> On the HMI you must see two vehicles instead of one (the second being a 3 seconds delayed copy of the first one)**
